alert.note: Alert for Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 25 at 9:19PM CDT until April 08 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...Arkansas...Tennessee... Mississippi River at Caruthersville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Caruthersville... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING TO SATURDAY, APRIL 8... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Caruthersville. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening to Saturday, April 8. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, in Missouri, docks of the steel mill near Hickman are flooding. In Tennessee, Mississippi River overbank flooding is occurring across Highway 88 just north of Dee Webb Road. Extensive amounts of Chickasaw National Wildlife Refuge are flooded. Sloughs at the west end of Barr Road are beginning to back up into fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above action stage Tuesday evening to a crest near 32.0 feet over the weekend. It will then begin a gradual fall. - Action stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
